title: Small Farm Irrigation - Video 5 - Attaching and Plugging Drip Tape to a Lay Flat Header Pipe

tasks.task: Attaching drip tape to a header pipe and plugging the end
subtasks: Attach the drip tape to the fitting by twisting to the right with tightness
Use a Phillips head screwdriver to punch a hole in the lay flat header while water is on (be cautious with screwdriver size to prevent leaks)
Push the fitting into the hole, ensuring a secure connection (listen or feel for a pop)
Once water is turned off, cut a 1-2 inch piece from the end of the tape
Fold the cut end of the tape over twice and then in half to create a secure plug
Verify water flow through the tape to check proper plugging
Tidy the tape by releasing kinks to ensure water reaches the end
Cover the taped area with soil every foot or so to anchor the tape in place, being cautious not to damage it

tasks.task: Ensuring proper use and benefits of the installed irrigation system
subtasks: Confirm that the water is being applied directly to the plants without wetting the plant or fruit
Recognize the conservation of water and reduction in plant disease spread and food safety risk as benefits of the system
